intro: Pedicularis cernua var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial with distinctive, spurred flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features broad, heart-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, rocky habitats. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its parasitic or hemiparasitic relationships with host plants.
